content: PARIS — Rafael Nadal lost in the first round of the French Open to Alexander Zverev 6-3, 7-6 (5), 6-3 on Monday in what might turn out to be the 14-time Roland Garros champion’s last match at his favorite tournament. It is the first time in his long and illustrious career that Nadal has been beaten in two consecutive matches on clay courts and the first time he has dropped a match earlier than the fourth round at the French Open. His career record at the clay-court Grand Slam tournament is now 112-4. The match was played with the retractable roof shut at Court Philippe Chatrier, and the loud cheers for Nadal from most in the capacity crowd of about 15,000 echoed throughout. Nadal, who owns 22 major trophies in all, turns 38 on June 3 and he has been dealing with hip and abdominal injuries since January 2023, limiting him to 15 matches and an 8-7 record since the start of last year. His infrequent play dropped his ranking to No. 275 and he was unseeded for the French Open for the first time. Nadal has indicated 2024 likely would be his last season before retirement but he said Saturday that he is not 100% sure he won’t play again at the French Open. And he reiterated that after Monday’s defeat. His three other losses at Roland Garros came against Robin Soderling in 2010 and against Novak Djokovic in 2015 and 2021.

title: Staten Island stays on winning path as homers lead to 12-7 victory
description: Hawks move back into 1st place.
content: YORK, Pa. -- The Staten Island FerryHawks are back in first place after hitting their way to a 12-7 victory over the York Revolution at WellSpan Park on Sunday. It was another strong offensive performance for Staten Island. Robert Brooks’ two-homer, five-RBI performance led the way for the FerryHawks. Ben Norman’s bat stayed hot, going 3 for 5 with two RBI. Nate Scantlin went 2 for 6 with two RBI, Taylor Motter went 3 for 5 with an RBI and Pablo Sandoval contributed with a 2-for-5, two-RBI performance.

title: Pet profile of the week: Baxter, a three-legged good boy in search of a home
description: A gorgeous 6-year-old mix, Baxter came to Midcoast Humane from Oklahoma with an old injury to his front leg. Because it appeared to still be causing him discomfort, our medical team took X-rays and determined that removing the leg would be the best for Baxter’s long-term outcome. Now healed from his surgery, Baxter is ready [...]
content: Baxter. Courtesy of Midcoast Humane A gorgeous 6-year-old mix, Baxter came to Midcoast Humane from Oklahoma with an old injury to his front leg. Because it appeared to still be causing him discomfort, our medical team took X-rays and determined that removing the leg would be the best for Baxter’s long-term outcome. Now healed from his surgery, Baxter is ready for his new family! He has had a lot of transitions and he needs a home that understands it may take him a little while to settle in. Only having three legs doesn’t slow him down at all, and he’ll happily go for walks with you and then have a good snuggle on the couch. If Baxter sounds like he could be your boy, come on in to the Brunswick campus and ask to meet him! Success. Please wait for the page to reload. title: Streamer says ‘Kick’ 1 million times to complete epic 233-hour subathon
creator: Michael Gwilliam
description: A Kick streamer challenged himself to repeat the word ‘Kick’ a whopping one million times in an epic charity subathon.
content: Kick streamer ‘ShaktyG’ challenged himself to repeat the word ‘Kick’ a whopping one million times in an epic charity subathon. Imagine repeating the same word one million times? It sounds ridiculous and time-consuming, but that’s exactly what happened when streamer ‘ShaktyG’ set out to raise money for charity. After being live for over 233 hours, ShaktyG finally completed his goal, but the journey was not easy, to say the least. Over 233 hours streamed himself saying Kick 1,000,000 times for charity! 💚 Like most , the timer increases with each sub or follow, but ShaktyG faced a problem after taking 115 hours to get half-way through his goal. Even though he was only having 3-4 hours of sleep during the challenge, he remaining to say Kick 1M times, so he decided to keep going, even if the countdown hit zero. Fortunately, the Kick community came through with a massive boost, giving him more time to complete the challenge as originally intended. 70% of the way through! I underestimated the power of the Kick community. I thought the timer was going to run out today and hit 0, but the followers and subs came through, and we still have more than 5 hours on the countdown timer! Eventually, when all was said and done, he was able to hit 1,432 subs and 2,646 follows. Upon saying the final ‘Kick,’ the streamer was on the verge of tears and was visibly trying to hold back his emotions. Following the end of the stream, ShaktyG thanked everyone involved for helping him on his quest. “From fellow streamers raiding and dropping by with words of encouragement, to the Kick staff boosting my reach, and to my parents and girlfriend who even donated because they couldn’t bear to see the countdown timer hit zero! I’m truly blessed to share this moment with you all and am incredibly thankful to be part of this amazing community,” he . “Saying ‘Kick’ a million times was not just about charity; it was a personal challenge to prove to myself that I can achieve anything I set my mind to. No matter how many times I stumble, I’ll always find a way to rise and make you all proud.” The money raised will be donated to the appropriately-named food distribution project ‘Kick out Hunger.’ As for ShaktyG, he’s already about what he’ll tackle next and if it’s anything like his ‘Kick’ subathon, expect big things from this up-and-coming content creator.

title: Toyota Road Trek disrupted by PAL delays
creator: Ira Panganiban
description: THE 17th edition of the annual Toyota Road Trek unfolded on May 15, 2024. This event serves as Toyota's gesture of appreciation to its media allies for their yearlong support, and doubles as an opportunity to showcase the brand's latest products, either recently launched or scheduled for later release.Not everyone receives an invitation to the Toyota Road Trek. It might be perceived as an exclusive gathering, akin to an old boys club (inclusive of women, of course), but it's primarily a logistical matter. Toyota can only accommodate a limited number of automotive journalists for the event, or else risk financial strain.This year's journey promised to be extraordinary as we aimed for Davao City, followed by a retreat at the enchanting Discovery Resort on Samal Island. The plan was straightforward: depart at 8:30 a.m. from Terminal 2 in NAIA, and arrive at Davao International Airport by 10:30 a.m.The itinerary included driving the latest Toyota models around scenic and cultural spots in Davao City and nearby areas upon landing, allowing ample time for picturesque snapshots of the vehicles against stunning backdrops.However, things didn't go as planned.Due to unfortunate circumstances or subpar fleet management, our flight via Philippine Airlines (PAL) was delayed by six hours, departing Manila at 2:30 p.m., throwing the Toyota Road Trek schedule into disarray.This delay not only inconvenienced our plans but also incurred significant costs for Toyota Motor Philippines.Subsequently, we learned that PAL was operating with constraints. Out of the 78 aircraft intended for service, 14 were reportedly grounded for maintenance. Yet PAL persisted with its flight schedules without adjustments, resulting in delays and involuntary boarding denials.In such instances, passengers are often rescheduled onto subsequent flights, potentially on smaller aircraft, necessitating a reduction in the number of passengers accommodated.Four members of our group narrowly avoided being denied boarding, thanks to the intervention of PAL's Corporate Communications head Cielo Villaluna, who ensured our group boarded together.Yet, it's disheartening to note PAL's apparent disregard for customer welfare. Despite the extensive delay, passengers received only fast-food burgers and water to satiate their hunger, surpassing the airline passenger rights threshold of four hours without appropriate compensation.On the return journey, Toyota collected our contact details, indicating PAL's assurance of compensation. However, as of writing, no compensation has been received, leaving doubts regarding its adequacy in compensating for the six-hour disruption caused by flight delays.Nevertheless, Toyota's Road Trek persisted amid the challenges, celebrated with fervor within the limited time available. Once again, Toyota demonstrated its commitment, allowing us to explore the Philippines in their vehicles.Salamat po Toyota! Sa uulitin! (Thank you Toyota! Until next time!)As for PAL ... booooo!!!!

title: Pro League Network Secures $2.2 Million to Revolutionize Betting on Niche Sports
creator: Deyan Dimitrov
description: Pro League Network (PLN) has raised $2.2 million to bring betting opportunities to niche sports like slapfighting, CarJitsu, and streetball. Founded in 2022 by Mike Salvaris and Bill Yucatonis, PLN is well-known for commercializing more obscure sports like minigolf, regulating them for gambling purposes, and capitalizing on the novelty of its offerings to differentiate itself [...]
content: (PLN) has raised to bring betting opportunities to niche sports like , , and . Founded in 2022 by and , PLN is well-known for commercializing more obscure sports like , regulating them for gambling purposes, and capitalizing on the novelty of its offerings to differentiate itself from the competition. PLN’s Approach Continues to Pay Dividends Operating from its studio in , PLN’s approach is to identify sports that can quickly capture fan interest on social media and are easy for to understand and bet on after a short watch. This strategy aims to in the sports-wagering calendar during periods with few or no live professional sports available for betting. High-profile sportsbooks, including and , have PLN’s properties in states and markets where they have received approval for wagering. During a recent interview for , company co-founder Bill Yucatonis noted that targeting such unique offerings enabled PLN to for operators, providing them with engaging content during typically slow periods. “ ” Over the next 12 months, PLN plans to expand several of its : CarJitsu, SlapFight Championship, and Str33t, a professional 3×3 basketball league developed in partnership with ’s . The company will also continue supporting the for professional minigolf, which has repeatedly to wagering fans. The Company Had to Fight for Its Vision PLN’s unique approach, owning and operating the sports properties, was vital in . The company faced as investors were uncertain whether would approve such niche sports for gambling. However, PLN quickly proved the when SlapFight Championship became the in its portfolio to get the green light in several jurisdictions. As PLN grows its portfolio of supported sports, it cements its position as the of unorthodox sports wagering experiences and positions itself for . To support this expansion, the company intends to on the East Coast and produce two to four hours of live content weekly. With this newly acquired funding, PLN is ready to of sports entertainment and wagering, offering fans and bettors a novel and engaging experience. The company remains committed to with new offerings, targeting niche sports that are easy to comprehend, captivating to watch, and likely to go viral.

title: DU PG Admission 2024: Delhi University extends registration till June 5. Quick guide to apply at admission.uod.ac.in
description: DU PG Admissions 2024: Delhi University has extended the Common Seat Allocation System for Postgraduates (CSAS PG) registration date until June 5 due to the ongoing general election. Now, the registration window will remain open till 11.59 pm, June 5, 2024
content: DU PG Admissions 2024: Delhi University (DU) has extended the Common Seat Allocation System for Postgraduates (CSAS PG) 2024 registration date until June 5, 2024, due to the ongoing general election 2024. Now, the registration window for DU PG Admissions 2024 will remain open till 11.59 pm, June 5, 2024. Interested candidates can apply for admission in 82 postgraduate programmes for the academic session 2024-25 based on the scores obtained in the Common University Entrance Test- postgraduate (CUET-PG) 2024 conducted by NTA at the official website of Delhi University at admission.uod.ac.in. Along with CSAG PG 2024, the university has also extended the registration last date for BA LL.B. (H), BBA LL.B. (H) and B. Tech. programmes till June 5, 2025. Also Read | “With respect to the ongoing General Election-2024, the registration to CSAS (PG) 2024, BA LL.B. (H), BBA LL.B. (H) and B. Tech. Programs have been extended till 11:59 P.M, Wednesday 05th June, 2024," Delhi University said in a statement. Now, the application correction window will open on June 5 and will close on June 12, 2024 “The Correction Window will be available from Wednesday, 05th June, 2024 to Wednesday, 12th June, 2024," the notification further read. Also Read | Admissions to the postgraduate programmes offered by the University of Delhi will be primarily based on the scores obtained in the Common University Entrance Test (CUET) PG-2024 “For the academic year 2024-25, admission to all PG Programs of UoD will be done on the basis of the Common University Entrance Test- Postgraduate 2024 (CUET (PG) – 2024) only. Admitting students through UoD’s online platform Common Seat Allocation System (PG)-2024 is binding on all Colleges and Departments, as applicable, of the University of Delhi," the notification read. Also Read | DU PG Admission 2024: Application Fee As per DU notification, general, OBC, and EWS category students must pay a registration fee of 250. Students of SC, ST, and PWBD categories need to pay 100. An additional fee of 100 will be charged for those applying under the sports quota. DU PG Admissions 2024: Step-by-Step guide to apply for PG courses Candidates who have obtained passing marks in the CUET PG 2024 are eligible to register for admission to PG courses at Delhi University this academic year. Also Read | According to media reports, the university is likely to fill 13,500 seats for the PG admission process, including 120 seats each for BTech and 60 seats each for BA LLB and BBA LLB courses. Once the seat allocation list is published, candidates must complete the payment to confirm their allotment before the specified deadline. We have more newsletters Show Me No thanks, close See our Privacy Notice Almost one year on from their Ulster SFC final battle, Derry and Armagh collide once more in the group stage of this year’s All-Ireland SFC. Derry defeated Armagh on penalties last season and the Orchard County suffered a similar fate in this season’s provincial decider with Donegal beating both teams in Ulster. While Kieran McGeeney’s men returned to winning ways last weekend with an encouraging performance against Westmeath , Mickey Harte’s Derry suffered a second successive Championship defeat when losing out to Galway in Pearse Stadium in their Group One opener. Read more: Damian McErlain hails “composure” of Derry minors as incredible Ulster Championship record continues Read more: Sean Cavanagh column: Donegal are serious contenders for Sam Maguire, but Tyrone aren't finished yet Gareth McKinless was also sent off for standing on Damien Comer’s leg in the first half of that five-point loss and the Ballinderry defender will miss this weekend’s game as a result while Eoin McEvoy and Conor Doherty were also absent from the Derry team in round one. Armagh will be hoping to have Rian O’Neill back for the Derry clash but Conor O’Neill is out for the rest of the season with an Achilles injury. Here’s more information on Derry vs Armagh and how to watch it. . .. When and where is the game? Derry vs Armagh is on Sunday, June 2 at Celtic Park, Derry. What time is throw-in? Sunday’s game starts at 4pm. Where can I watch it? Sunday’s game is being broadcast live on RTÉ2. title: OSI Systems: Security Provider Is On Fire
content: AzmanJaka/E+ via Getty Images It has been a very long time since I covered shares of OSI Systems ( NASDAQ: OSIS ), in fact, it was the summer of 2016 when I concluded that appeal was increasing despite a somewhat troubled deal. Fast forwarding in time, OSI has seen solid growth and this has resulted in real value being delivered for its shareholders, all of which makes an update on the investment case long overdue. Fast forwarding some 8 years in time, OSI has seen continued growth. On a trailing basis, OSI has grown sales towards the $1.5 billion mark, aided by a couple of huge security orders in recent times. This created a strong 2024, although more orders keep the backlog flat here, creating interesting dynamics going forward, as not all segments are putting in their fair share here. Advanced, Reliable And Critical Electronics Solutions OSI provides advanced and reliable electronics solutions for critical applications across various diversified essential markets. The company is active across three segments which includes security, optoelectronics and healthcare. The security business is by far the largest segment, and the most profitable one, responsible for about 60% of sales. These revenues are generated from the development and manufacturing of security screening systems and solutions for governments, civil infrastructure, border & port security, among others. Optoelectronics is responsible for a quarter of sales, with revenues generated from components and solutions such as photodetectors, laser diodes and lex circuits in a wide range of applications. The remaining 15% of sales are generated in healthcare settings, including patient monitoring, cardiology, connected care and remote monitoring in various healthcare applications. In terms of geographies, half of sales are generated in the US, with the remainder generated notably in the EMEA region, APAC and the remainder of the Americas. When I last looked at the shares in 2016, the company had just completed a decade long period during which the company doubled its sales and grew adjusted earnings to $3 per share, while shares traded at a relatively modest $50 valuation. This was in part the result of shares falling at the time due to some operating hiccups, as the company announced a somewhat troubled acquisition as well. Between 2016 and today, the company has grown sales from around a billion to $1.3 billion in 2023, although that earnings doubled to $6 per share over this point in time. All this means that shares, which traded at $50 in 2016, have traded in a $50-$100 range all the way until the spring of last year. A $100 stock in the spring of last year was unleashed and rose to the $145 mark as of recent, actually trading at all-time highs here. Picking Up The Valuation Here In August of last year, OSI posted its fiscal 2023 results. Full year revenues were up 8% to $1.28 billion, aided by very strong results in the final quarter of last year when sales were up 22%. The company actually saw actual gross profitability down, as the company posted operating profits of $121 million, with the company posting GAAP earnings of $6.45 per share. That however included a one-time gain on the sale of property, with adjusted earnings of $5.81 per share actually being down forty cents on the year before. The company operated with net debt of $288 million, a very manageable amount. The company guided for a spectacular improvement in 2024 results, with revenues seen up more than 18%, with adjusted earnings seen up more than 25% on the year before. This was supported by a huge backlog, which rose some 46% to $1.8 billion after the company took in a few large orders, including a huge $600 million border inspection order from Mexico's Department of National Defense. In October of last year, the company posted first quarter results with sales up 4% to $279 million, with adjusted earnings up a modest four cents to $0.91 per share. While these results were not that spectacular, it prompted the company into hiking the full year earnings per share guidance, calling for more than 27% growth on an annual basis Second quarter sales were up some 26% to $373 million, with adjusted earnings up a dollar to $2.21 per share. Following this impressive quarter, the company now saw full year sales grow by more than 19%, with earnings per share growth seen in excess of 29%. In April, third quarter sales were reported up 34% to $405 million, with adjusted earnings up 45% to $2.16 per share. With earnings growth seen in excess of 30% per share here, earnings are expected to surpass $7.50 per share here. Given the greater earnings power here, net debt is down to about a quarter of a billion, as all this momentum is aided and supported by a continued backlog of $1.8 billion here. What Now? With 17.4 million shares of OSI trading at $145, equity of the company is valued at $2.52 billion, for a $2.77 billion enterprise valuation. This values the operations at less than 2 times sales with shares trading at 19 times earnings, after a great momentum run seen, with net leverage seen around 1.5 times. What is of interest is that here is great divergence between the segments. Irony will it that through the first nine months of the year, revenues for the optoelectronics and healthcare division are down, and the same applies for margins. This shows that all this momentum is driven by the security division, which has reported a 42% increase in sales so far this year to $700 million, pushing up its share to two-thirds of sales. This also shows the potential for other value accretive moves as the healthcare segment is barely profitable here, leaving potential for OSI to over time, become a more focused business, as the security business is notably the biggest, fastest growing business and also the most profitable segment out there. Amidst all this, I am performing a balancing act. A 19 times earnings multiple, given the organic growth performance, looks appealing, but arguably a few big orders have been driving 2024 growth. That said, after conversion of these orders one were to expect a decline in sales next year, but the backlog has been rather constant, as the order intake remains sound. This looks positive, but of course, growth has been rather dismal in recent years. Given this, I am performing a balancing act, but expect much tougher comparables here going forward. Given this, and the fact that shares have been doing quite well, having risen to fresh all-time highs here, I am leaning cautious here, anticipating some kind of normalization in fiscal 2025. On the other hand, there is potential for segments outside the security business to create value here as well, and despite the interesting dynamics and set-up, I am quite cautious and not willing to chase the shares here. title: Bayelsa tribunal upholds Gov Diri’s re-election
creator: Mayowa Oladeji
description: The Bayelsa State governorship election petition tribunal has dismissed the petition filed by the All Progressives Congress (APC) and its candidate, Timipre Sylva, challenging the re-election of Governor Douye Diri. In a unanimous decision, the three-man panel led by Justice Adekunle Adeleye held that the petitioners failed to provide credible evidence to support their allegations [...]The post Bayelsa tribunal upholds Gov Diri’s re-election appeared first on Latest Nigeria News | Top Stories from Ripples Nigeria.
content: The Bayelsa State governorship election petition tribunal has dismissed the petition filed by the All Progressives Congress (APC) and its candidate, Timipre Sylva, challenging the re-election of Governor Douye Diri. In a unanimous decision, the three-man panel led by Justice Adekunle Adeleye held that the petitioners failed to provide credible evidence to support their allegations of irregularities in the governorship poll. The tribunal struck out additional proof of evidence and witness statements filed by the petitioners, citing a breach of electoral laws. It also dismissed allegations of forgery against Deputy Governor Lawrence Ewhrudjakpo, stating that the issue was a pre-election matter that had become statute barred. The tribunal noted that the petitioners’ prayers were contradictory, seeking both a declaration as winners and a nullification of the election. It held that the petitioners failed to discharge the burden of proof and unable to show specific polling units where irregularities occurred and how it affected the outcome. Justice Adeleye, who read the lead judgment, noted that some allegations contained elements of criminality that ought to have been proved beyond reasonable doubt. The tribunal upheld preliminary objections filed by the respondents, challenging the competence of the petition. Opinions Balanced, fearless journalism driven by data comes at huge financial costs. title: The best Memorial Day sales: New deals on our favorite tested products and brands

title: A man died after I didn't speak up, and I still feel guilty about it, says DR SCURR. But second opinions aren't enough to save lives - it's the culture of hospitals that has to change
description: The death of 13-year-old Martha Mills brought back bitter memories of the death of one of my own patients. It also confirmed for me why Martha's rule won't help the situation in our NHS hospitals.
content: A man died after I didn't speak up, and I still feel guilty about it, says DR SCURR. But second opinions aren't enough to save lives - it's the culture of hospitals that has to change By Dr Martin Scurr Published: 11:55 EDT, 27 May 2024 | Updated: 12:41 EDT, 27 May 2024 e-mail 7 shares View comments The tragic death of 13-year-old Martha Mills following poor, possibly negligent care at a major London hospital brought back bitter memories of the death of one of my own patients. It also confirmed for me why, sadly, the plan to introduce Martha’s rule — which would give every patient in hospital the right to a second opinion from other experts at the same hospital — won’t help. In February, the Government announced that hospitals in England were to be offered funding to roll out the rule. Already 143 have signed up, it was reported today, and should be operating the scheme by 2025. Martha’s parents have been heroic in their efforts to try to spare others the awful, needless loss of a loved one . Martha's rule follows the tragic death of 13-year-old Martha Mills, who died after developing sepsis in 2021 under the care of King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust in South London But Martha’s rule, while laudable, cannot, I am afraid, do one thing that’s vital to its success: and that is to change our hospital culture . I don’t mean just that people are afraid to speak up, to challenge the hierarchy of senior doctors, for that is still an issue (although it is improving, slowly). I mean the lack of continuity of care — no longer taking full responsibility for a patient for their whole hospital ‘journey’ — which came when the structure of hospital care changed from the late 1990s. There’s no doubt that when you have concerns, questioning the doctor is an entirely acceptable and justified approach. And it can save lives. I have never forgiven myself for not intervening more aggressively on one of my own patient’s behalf, with hindsight knowing that if I had, he would have survived. The only way to stop preventable deaths occurring in the NHS is to change our hospital culture, writes Dr Martin Scurr He’d taken himself to A&E — as in Martha’s case, to a top London hospital (although a different one) — on a Friday night with a high temperature, rigors (sweating and shivering) and severe pain down one side of his abdomen. Yes, he was nearly 90 and had type 2 diabetes and a history of heart surgery, but until the day he fell ill with a kidney infection, he’d been able to work — full time. Always dressed in a three-piece suit and the upright bearing of a gentleman, he was the image of how many of us would like to be seen at that seniority: elegant and cognitively intact. But when I went to the hospital to see him on the Monday afternoon after my morning appointments — with three days’ beard growth, desperately ill with developing sepsis, dehydrated and now slightly confused — he was lying parked in a corner bed, where he’d spent all weekend on a small dose of an antibiotic, by mouth: with sepsis he should have been on an antibiotic drip. I was worried about his state and I phoned the consultant (the ward staff were unhelpful, but I found the name of the consultant over the head of the bed). The consultant told me that as it was nearly 5pm, the patient would now be handed over to a new team. That was where I should have intervened — even though as just his GP, I had as much authority as any loved one. What my patient needed was immediate intensive care, but as I suspect many medics would do, I deferred to the hierarchy — I was treading on territory where I had no mandate, hoping instead that the consultant would inform the colleague who was about to take over, about my concern. But I should have stepped over that invisible line. For while those who cared for him in the real world knew this man in his normal, healthy and magnificent self, the hospital team clearly viewed him as a pre-terminal geriatric with a urinary infection. He died the next day having received minimal care with nobody keeping an eye on him to witness his rapid deterioration. I took his death very badly. I felt very guilty that I had not intervened more successfully. As I see it, a major contribution to this sort of tragedy is fragmentation of care — lack of continuity under one single hospital team. This is the result of the loss of the old system where care was provided by a traditional ‘firm’, a team headed by one or two consultants with senior registrars (just below the level of consultant), registrars, senior house officers (two to three years out of medical school) and housemen (recent graduates from medical school). Read More 'Changing the culture of the NHS': As Martha's Rule comes into force, what it means for you and your loved ones - and the complete list of hospitals already signed up In the old ‘firm’ system there was accountability going up through each level of the team: the most junior members saw the most of the patients and when things went badly, they aired their concerns with the next level up; for example, to the registrar, who may well discuss with the senior registrar, and at times the consultant was then involved. This might sound like a recipe for ‘group think’, a sort of mindless consensus of opinion — but my argument would be that the recurrent audit and introspection about whether the right action is being taken countered that. Also, it was not unheard of for a consultant or senior registrar to make a decision to ask another team to come and have a look — a sort of joint team meeting. The sense of responsibility of the firm meant you would often see the senior doctors pop in on the weekend if they were worried about a particular patient. But in my patient’s case, the old type of ‘firm’ had long gone (the victim of the shift in power to management and new restrictions on working hours). It was a weekend and so there was probably only one harassed junior doctor around, there was no Saturday ward round, probably nobody came to see my patient at all unless maybe one of the nursing team called the duty doctor to come along, who may have then shrugged their shoulders and noted that this was an old person on their way out... The old tight-knit team — caring for patients right through the duration of their period of treatment, holding full responsibility — has evolved into what we have now, with experience and increasing responsibility (and full accountability) lost. We will never get the genie back into the bottle and no amount of increased regulation or Care Quality Commission inspections and sanctions can possibly achieve the diligence of the past. Nor will a legal framework, Martha’s rule, enforcing the option of a second opinion when requested. Despite its undoubtedly good intentions, driven by such heartbreaking and needless tragedy, I believe that such a rule will be a non-starter: fiddling while Rome burns. NHS London Share or comment on this article: A man died after I didn't speak up, and I still feel guilty about it, says DR SCURR. But second opinions aren't enough to save lives - it's the culture of hospitals that has to change e-mail 7 shares Add comment

title: I’m A Celeb winner Sam Thompson sparks concern as he reveals he’s been hospitalised
keywords: i'm a celebrity... get me out of here
creator: Jack White
content: SAM Thompson has sparked concern among fans after revealing he was hospitalised over the weekend. The 31-year-old took to Instagram to share a snap of him with an IV drip in his arm. 4 Sam sparked concern with a snap of him in hospital Credit: Instagram 4 The reality star has been busy since winning I'm a Celeb last year Credit: Shutterstock 4 He will return to host After Sun with Indiyah and Amy for the new series of Love Island Credit: ITV I'm a Celebrity champ Sam captioned the photo with: "Not had the best bank holiday weekend." In another post, since deleted, the Made in Chelsea star appeared to suggest his trip to the hospital was down to exhaustion as he confessed to trying to do too much at once. Sam added that it had "caught up with him". It was recently revealed that Sam, who won I'm a Celebrity last year, will be taking a slight step back from his Love Island duties this year. He will continue to host the spin-off After Sun , alongside main presenter Maya Jama and former Islanders Indiyah Polack and Amy Hart . But Sam will not be hosting the official podcast, The Morning After, this year. Instead Chris Taylor , who recently took part in the All Stars series, will be replacing Sam on the podcast. Earlier this month it was reported Sam is getting ready to propose to his girlfriend Zara McDermott, another former Islander. Most read in TV BALOGUN'S BACK Rangers star Leon Balogun signs new one-year contract TOO FAR Inside Celtic star Greg Taylor's cup final spat with Rangers hero Todd Cantwell EUR ON Gers handed Champions League qualifying boost as Hearts discover Europa League fate 'YIKES' Scotland Euros hero spotted at Old Firm Cup final with radical hair change A source told OK! Magazine : "Sam is very close to proposing to Zara and think he will do it by the summer as they talk about getting married all the time and what their wedding would be like. "They’re torn over having a traditional English wedding or doing something abroad in somewhere like Ibiza and just having all their friends and family out there for a few days. This Morning chaos as blunder 'gives away' Sam Thompson's location for new competition "They both love a party and want to be able to celebrate in style." 4 Sam is said to be close to proposing to girlfriend Zara Credit: PA Wire

title: Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley responds to criticism of 'controversial' post-season trip to Australia as she says 'revenue generating trips are crucial to commercial success'
description: Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley has taken to social media to issue a response to the widespread criticism of her team's short post-season Australia tour.
content: Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley responds to criticism of 'controversial' post-season trip to Australia as she says 'revenue generating trips are crucial to commercial success' Newcastle faced Tottenham and an A-League All-Stars XI in Melbourne last week The short trip to Australia received widespread criticism from the football world Chelsea are 'baffling'... Mauricio Pochettino has NOT failed - where do the Blues go from here? Listen to the It's All Kicking Off! Podcast By Spencer Morgan Published: 17:19 BST, 27 May 2024 | Updated: 17:41 BST, 27 May 2024 e-mail View comments Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley has taken to social media to issue a response to the widespread criticism of her team's short post-season Australia tour. Eyebrows were raised when the Magpies made the trip Down Under just days after the conclusion of a long season with a summer of international football ahead. Newcastle beat Tottenham on penalties in a friendly in Melbourne before seeing a second string XI get hammered 8-0 by an A-League All Stars team just two days later. Few could see the justification of the two games on the other wise of the world with club legend Alan Shearer labelling it 'madness' and 'crazy'. And Staveley, who spent the weekend at the Monaco Grand Prix, admits she understands the concerns. Newcastle co-owner Amanda Staveley has responded to criticism of the team's Australia tour Your browser does not support iframes. In a post on Instagram, she wrote: 'I've seen a lot of comments about the NUFC Australia trip which I'd like to address. Besides being a shareholder, I am first and foremost a fan. 'As a fan, I understand that this trip was controversial. However, personal opinions aside, revenue generating trips are crucial to a clubs commercial success. 'The decision to go was taken by management, and ultimately I have to support their decisions. A second string Magpies XI were thrashed 8-0 by an A-League All-Stars team Down Under 'Nobody wants a fresh team ready for the season more than me, and we are doing everything we can to support our manager in achieving this. 'Mehrdad [Ghodoussi] and I had a very productive working trip to Monaco with a potential sponsor,' Staveley added. We are looking ahead to the new season. We Are United.' title: Dessert in a glass: no need to bake
description: It turns out to be very low in calories
content: You can make a delicious and healthy dessert even without baking. All you need to do is put the ingredients in a regular glass. This dish can be made extremely light and dietary - you just need to choose the right ingredients. The idea of making a vanilla dessert in a glass was published on the Instagram page of a food blogger with the nickname ua.zozh . Ingredients: Method of preparation: 1. Soak 10 g of gelatin in 50 ml of milk for 10 minutes. 2. Mix cottage cheese, milk and sugar. 3. Heat the gelatin in the microwave, but do not boil. 4. Add gelatin to our mixture and beat well with a blender, then divide into 4 equal parts. 5. Add coffee to one, cocoa to the second, vanilla to the third, and you can add whatever you want to the fourth: orange zest, lemon zest, or grind your favorite berries, you can even make three layers. 6. Next, pour the first layer into the bowls and send it to the freezer until it hardens, and so on with all the layers. 7. When you put the last layer, put it in the refrigerator until it freezes completely.

title: Porsche Car Crash: Pune Court Sends Sassoon Hospital Doctors Who Changed Minor’s Blood Samples to Police Custody Till May 30
description: Arguing for police remand, the police said that they wanted to investigate the hospital records, mobile phone details and other connected aspects, but accused Dr. Taware's lawyer Jitendra Sawant and others argued strongly against the police custody.
content: A Pune court magistrate A.A. Pande on Monday remanded two doctors of a government hospital and a peon to police custody till May 30 (Thursday) for alleged tampering of the blood samples of a minor boy whose Porsche car killed two techies. The medicos are -- Sassoon Hospital's Head of Forensics Department, Dr. Ajay Taware and Blood Bank head, Dr. Shrihari Halnor, besides a peon Atul Ghatkamble, who was the alleged conduit for the illegal gratification in the matter. Arguing for police remand, the police said that they wanted to investigate the hospital records, mobile phone details and other connected aspects, but accused Dr. Taware's lawyer Jitendra Sawant and others argued strongly against the police custody. Marking a sensational twist, Pune Commissioner of Police Amitesh Kumar said earlier on Monday that the blood samples analysed by the Sassoon Hospital did not match with the minor accused in the Porsche car crash. Kumar said that the purported blood sample of the 17-year-old who was caught in the car crash, was "thrown in the dustbin" and the blood sample analysed was of a 'third person', which is being probed now. The shocking details emerged barely hours after the Pune Police raided and arrested the senior doctors and the peon of the Sassoon Hospital for allegedly 'tampering' with the minor accused's blood report. "We had taken a second blood sample which was given to another hospital for analysis with the intention of carrying out a DNA test later. Now, it has come to light that the Sassoon Hospital blood forensic report was of some other person," Kumar told mediapersons. Kumar said that Vishal A. Agarwal (the accused's father) had telephoned Dr. Taware on WhatsApp which is being probed, and the police now have sufficient technical evidence in the matter to prepare a water-tight case against all the accused. The three accused have been shunted to police custody for three days, as the charges of manipulating the crucial blood samples of the 17-year-old boy and submitting a fake blood test report could directly impact the prosecution case and the direction of the police investigation. "I shall repeat... our case does not rest on the blood samples. The minor boy was in his full senses and aware of the consequences of drinking and driving the car at high speed," reiterated Kumar. The 'clean chit' in the blood test report of the accused minor boy, the son of a prominent realtor Vishal S. Agarwal, had sparked a huge row as it enabled him to get off on bail within 15 hours of the fatal May 19 crash in Kalyani Nagar area. In the same case, Vishal S. Agarwal, who was sent to judicial custody for 14 days, was booked in a case pertaining to the tampering of evidence, confining, luring and threatening driver Gangaram Poojari to take the blame for the accident, but he refused and has become a prime prosecution witness. The fatal crash claimed the lives of two IT engineers -- Ashwini Koshtha and her friend Aneesh Awadhiya -- both 24, and hailing from Madhya Pradesh. The minor boy is currently lodged in a Juvenile Correctional Home in Pune. His father is in judicial custody while his grandfather Surendra Kumar Agarwal is in police custody in the same case that has sparked a nationwide furor. So far, at least 9 persons have been arrested in the Porsche case, including three generations of the Agarwal family. They are -- the 17-year-old boy, his father Vishal S. Agarwal, his grandfather Surendra Kumar Agarwal, the two doctors, a peon, the three owners-managers of the pub and bar where the boy and his friends had partied on Saturday-Sunday night -- while two cops of Yerwada Police Station, PI Rahul Jagdale and API Vishwanath Todkari have been suspended for alleged dereliction of duty and other lapses pertaining to the accident, as public anger continues to simmer.

title: Texas House Prices Buck Nationwide Trend
description: Two Texas metropolitan areas were the only two in the country to experience price drops in the four weeks ending May 19, according to a recent Redfin report.
content: While house prices in the U.S. reached another record high during the four weeks ending May 19, , two metropolitan areas in Texas have seen them sliding down in the same time frame, going against national trend. San Antonio and Fort Worth experienced the biggest—and only—year-over-year median sale price decreases in the four weeks ending May 19, with drops of respectively -1 percent and -0.6 percent. As of April, the latest data available on Redfin's website, the median sale price of a home in San Antonio was , up 1.5 percent year-over-year; in Fort Worth, it was $330,000, down 2.9 percent compared to April 2023. In the four weeks ending on May 19, the median U.S. home sale price hit a record $387,600, up 4 percent compared to a year earlier—an all-time high. The national median asking price reached a record $420,250 in the same period, up 6.6 percent year-over-year—another all-time high. contacted Redfin for comment by email on Monday. The steady rise of the price of homes in the U.S., which followed a brief housing market correction between late summer 2022 and spring 2023, is mainly being driven by a historic shortage of homes in the country. But stubbornly high mortgage rates are also playing a role, pricing out aspiring homebuyers and discouraging homeowners from letting go of their lower-mortgage properties and putting them on the market. ​​"Move-up buyers feel stuck because they're ready for their next house, but it just doesn't make financial sense to sell with current interest rates so high," said , a Redfin agent in tah, in a news release. "The homeowners listing right now are often doing so because they need to: one of my clients is selling because of a family emergency, and another couple is selling because they had a baby and simply don't have enough room," he added. "Buyers should take note that many of today's sellers are motivated; if a home doesn't have other offers on the table, offer under asking price and/or ask for concessions because many sellers are willing to negotiate." High housing costs have led to one of the biggest declines in home sales in three months, according to Redfin. In the four weeks ending May 19, home sales were down 4.2 percent year-over-year. In the previous four-week period, home sales were down 4.4 percent compared to a year earlier. Three of the top five metropolitan areas with the biggest year-over-year increases were in California. In Anaheim, California, the median sale price of a home increased by 20.1 percent; in San Jose, California, by 12.9 percent; and in Oakland, California, by 12.5 percent. The other two cities in the top five were Detroit, Michigan, which experienced an increase of 16.9 percent and West Palm Beach, Florida, where the median sale price of a home rose by 12 percent. Newsweek is committed to challenging conventional wisdom and finding connections in the search for common ground. title: Rabri Devi takes jibe at PM's 'mujra' remarks: 'Does Modi play the tabla?'
description: Rabri Devi, RJD's founding president and Lalu Prasad Yadav's wife, stated that citing defeat in the Lok Sabha polls, the BJP-led NDA had ‘gone crazy and taken to blabbering’.
content: A couple of days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi made the infamous "mujra" remark about the opposition INDIA bloc in Bihar during the Lok Sabha election campaign, former Bihar chief minister and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Rabri Devi on Monday hit back in the same coin. She didn't hesitate to ridicule PM Modi when journalists drew her attention to the remark. She said, as quoted by news agency , "And what does Modi do? Play the tabla?" Rabri Devi, RJD's founding president and Lalu Prasad Yadav's wife, stated that facing defeat in the Lok Sabha polls, the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) had “gone crazy and taken to blabbering". On being asked to respond to a comment by PM Modi, who alleged that the INDIA bloc was receiving support from 'jihadis' sponsored by Pakistan, she said, "If it is indeed so, what are the intelligence agencies doing? And before indulging in the dog whistle over Pakistan, they should remember one of their tallest leaders Lal Krishna Advani, who went on to become the deputy prime minister, was born in that country." What Asaduddin Owaisi said? Slamming the PM for making such comments, All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the PM was doing a disco dance with China when the latter's troops reportedly captured around 2,000 square kilometres of the Indian territory. He took to X and wrote, "@narendramodi Ji, you talked about Mujra, so Asaduddin Owaisi wants to ask you that for the last 3 years, China has occupied 2 thousand square kilometers of Indian land, Modi ji, you are not removing China, so were you doing Disco Dancing with China?" "Is this the type of language the prime minister should use? Does Modi think we do not have mouth to speak? ( )," Owaisi said. What PM Modi had said Addressing multiple poll rallies in Bihar, PM Modi attacked the INDIA bloc over the reservation issue and accused it of doing ‘mujra’ for the Muslim vote bank. "I am giving the guarantee to Bihar SC, ST, OBC communities, till Modi is alive, I will not let them snatch away their rights. For Modi, the Constitution is supreme, for Modi, Babasaheb Ambedkar's sentiments are supreme... if the INDI alliance wants to accept the servitude of their vote bank, they are free to do so...if they want to perform mujra (dance), they are free to do... I will still stand with the SC, ST, and OBC reservations staunchly. ," he said. Following his comments, he was criticised by several opposition leaders, including Congress' Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, National Conference's Farooq Abdullah, and the Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav. title: EastEnders Andy Hunter star is totally unrecognisable 19 years after soap exit
creator: staronline@reachplc.com (Laura Williams, Kelly Smith)
description: Michael Higgs is best known for his role as Andy Hunter in Eastenders but the star is looking worlds away from his Walford days, sporting grey hair and glasses in his recent roles
content: BBC star Michael Higgs is barely recognisable two decades after his departure from the soap. He first graced Albert Square as Andy Hunter in 1993, initially working for The Firm and serving as the main enforcer for boss Jack Dalton. However, when Jack was bumped off by Dennis Rickman in 2003, Andy stepped up to fill the void. He eventually made Walford his home and took over The Firm. During his stint on Albert Square, Andy had run-ins with Den Watts, Billy Mitchell and Minty Peterson. He also had romantic entanglements with Kat Slater and Sam Mitchell. After hiring a hitman to take out Paul Truman, Andy met his end at the hands of fellow gangster Johnny Allen. Since leaving the show, he has led a totally different life. The 61-year-old has enjoyed a really successful career and appeared in Casualty twice, playing different characters in 2010 and 2016, and has had roles in New Tricks and Midsomer Murders, reports . He also made his mark on the big screen, featuring in films such as Assassination Games, Prisoners of the Sun and The Marine 6: Close Quarters. Michael is also well known for his role in the Bill. Despite his impressive career, Michael looks a world away from his Walford days. More recent roles, saw him transform into a scholarly-looking silver fox - a far cry from the dark-haired, suave young man who stirred up trouble in Eastenders. In real life, he is married to Doc Martin actress Caroline Catz. The 52-year-old met her husband on the set of the police drama The Bill where she played the character of Rosie Fox The couple are parents to two children - Sonny Higgs, born in 2001, and Honour Higgs, born in 2006. Speaking to The Daily Mail, in the past the actress opened up about her personal life. She told the publication: "Michael and I met when we worked together on The Bill in the late 90s, although we didn't marry until 2007 when we already had the children. "Marriage to another actor means that there is no explanation needed for what you do. That's pretty refreshing".

title: Soccerladuma | Transfer Update: Aziz Ki
description: With Young Africans' Stephane Aziz Ki still being linked with a move to the DStv Premiership and his contract on the brink of expiration, the attacker's preferred next destination has reportedly been revealed.
content: With Young Africans' Stephane Aziz Ki still being linked with a move to the DStv Premiership and his contract on the brink of expiration, the attacker's preferred next destination has reportedly been revealed. The Burkina Faso international's future in Dar es Salaam hangs in the balance. The Tanzanian Premier League season is approaching its end and, consequently, so is the attacking midfielder's time with Yanga, as things stand. The 28-year-old's contract at the Benjamin Mkapa National Stadium expires at the end of the campaign, and his team is seemingly desperate to keep hold of his services after he helped them tremendously both domestically and on the continent. The Ivory Coast-born attacker has 17 goals in the league and is vying for Golden Boot honours, and also has two goals and two assists in the 12 CAF Champions League matches he played in for his club. As such, Yanga want to retain the 12-cap Burkinabe's services, and club president Hersi Said is believed to have initiated negotiations over an extension, but so far, Aziz Ki has not put pen to paper on a new deal. According to , the reason for his reluctance to commit his future to Young Africans is because he is leaning towards a move outside of Tanzania, preferably South Africa. The record Tanzanian champions are believed to have made a lucrative offer for him to extend his stay, but Aziz Ki is believed to be more receptive to accepting a move to the PSL. In recent weeks, the Adjame native has been linked with possible moves to the likes Kaizer Chiefs and Orlando Pirates, and given that he is approaching free agency, he has his destiny in his own hands.
